author: Nicole Morley
title: Man subjected to ‘disgraceful’ prolonged sexual assault on London Underground
text:
Police are appealing for information after a man reported prolonged sexual assault on his way to work (Picture: Getty) A man was subjected to a ‘disgraceful’ prolonged sexual assault by another man on the London Underground. 
The 38-year-old man was assaulted on a busy Victoria Line tube between Finsbury Park and Kings Cross.
Scottish Parliament expected to back Sturgeon’s call for second independence referendum Another male passenger, a slender white man believed to be in his mid-20s, approached him and began to touch him inappropriately at around 7.30am on his way to work on Wednesday March 22.
The man stood extremely close to the victim, who was standing on a packed carriage, and pressed himself against him.
He then touched him inappropriately in a prolonged assault.
The touching didn’t end until the victim left the train at Kings Cross.
The victim says the prolonged assault didn’t end until he got off the train at Kings Cross (Picture: Getty) More: UK Woman glassed in exclusive nightclub told she'll be scarred for the rest of her life

Investigating Detective Constable Suleman Yazdani, of the British Transport Police, said: ‘This was a disgraceful and prolonged assault committed on a busy commuter tube service. As you can imagine this was a frightening experience for him as he quite rightly did not expect or want this man to touch him. If you know someone who matches the description then please get in touch as your information could be vitally important.
‘Unwanted sexual behaviour such as this will never be tolerated and we work closely with our partners throughout the capital to encourage victims to report offences. Recently, we launched a refreshed version of the highly successful Report it to Stop it campaign, to tackle under-reporting and raise awareness of the reporting services.’
Pictured: Two boys, 17, found dead near cliffs in Saltburn A full description of the suspect released by Met Police reveals he is a white man, approximately 5f7in.
He is believed to be in his mid-twenties, with blue eyes and blonde hair that was curly on top.
At the time of the incident the suspect was wearing a camouflage jacket and black jeans and trainers. He was also holding a bright rucksack and had a black earning in his left ear.
Anyone with information about the incident is advised to contact, British Transport Police by sending a text to 61016 or by calling 0800 40 50 quoting reference 113 of 23/03/2017.
Alternatively, information can be passed anonymously to independent charity Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111.
